description: Elevation of the farm (in meters above sea level)

metric: 1 = Exposed subsoil, no superficial soil present. 2= Very shallow soil depth. 3= Thin superficial soil, approximately 5 cm. 4= Moderate soil depth, about 10 cm. 5= Significant superficial soil depth, more than >10 cm. 0= I am not sure.
description: Mean soil depth across three sites on the farm.
Number of different crop species (including perennial crops) produced on the farm in the last 12 months.
Total amount of labor hours invested per year per hectare of farm area (owned, rented, or used).
Total area of monoculture annual crops on the farm.
Total area of monoculture perennial crops on the farm.
Total area where residues were burned on the farm.
Total area of land cleared by the household.

factor: Number of ecological practices for pest management
description: Number of ecological pest management practices used on the farm in the last 12 months.

factor: Number of ecological practices for soil quality
description: Number of different ecological practices used on cropland to improve soil quality and health.
Number of different products (crops, livestock, fish, wood, honey, other) produced on the farm in the last 12 months.
Yield gap for the main crop, based on actual versus attainable yields.

sub_category: Social factors: stem from farmers’ interactions with others —such as peers or advisors—and encompass elements like social norms and injunctive norms. Injunctive norms encompass what farmers believe others expect of them. Social norms reflect both shared expectations about appropriate behaviour and individuals’ perceptions of how common or accepted certain practices are among others (Dessart et al. 2019).
factor: Distance to the nearest farm that implements DFS
description: Distance to the nearest farm that implements diversified farming systems (DFS).
Number of livestock the household possesses, measured in Tropical Livestock Units (TLU).
Number of different assets the household possesses (e.g., car, motorbike, bicycle, mobile phone, tractor).
Total income the household earned from non-farm sources (e.g., family business, casual labour, formal labour, transfers, leasing land, subsidies, other) in the last 12 months.
How many income sources did the household have in the last 12 months?
Total income the household earned from on-farm sources (e.g., crop, livestock, fish) in the last 12 months.
Total income the household earned from both on-farm and non-farm sources during the last 12 months.
Total number of children (<18 years old) living in the household.
Total number of people living in the household.

factor: Total adults (>65 years old) in household
description: Total number of adults (>65 years old) living in the household.

factor: Total adults (≥18 years old) in household
description: Total number of adults (≥18 years old) living in the household.

factor: Total adults (18-65 years old) in household
description: Total number of adults aged between 18 and 65 years old living in the household.
Age of the household head (in years).
Total number of secondary occupations held by the farmer.

factor: Permanent hired, free, or exchange labour density
description: Number of permanent hired, free, or exchange workers per hectare contributing to farming activities.
Number of household members working permanently in farming activities per hectare.

factor: Seasonal hired, free, or exchange labour density
description: Number of seasonal hired, free, or exchange workers per hectare contributing to farming activities.
Number of household members working seasonally in farming activities per hectare.

factor: Area of three main crops grown
description: Total area of land dedicated to the household's three main crops (in hectares).
Total area of land managed under sustainable agricultural practices (e.g., crop rotation, mulching farming, agroforestry).
Total area of land used for growing crops (in hectares).
Total size of the farm, including owned land, leased land, and land with use rights.
Total surface area of water bodies, wetlands, paddy fields, or other aquaculture systems used for fish production (in hectares).
Total area of land dedicated to livestock production, including owned and shared land (in hectares).
Total area of land used for agricultural production, including crops, livestock, and fish production (in hectares).

factor: Months of water shortage during a drought year
description: How many months of the year does the household find it difficult to access enough water for agricultural needs (e.g., growing crops, drinking water for livestock) during a drought year?

factor: Months of water shortage during a flood year
description: How many months of the year does the household find it difficult to access enough water for agricultural needs (e.g., growing crops, drinking water for livestock) during a flood year?

factor: Months of water shortage during a normal year
description: How many months of the year does the household find it difficult to access enough water for agricultural needs (e.g., growing crops, drinking water for livestock) during a normal year?
Number of years the household has been farming this land.
Area of cropland under agroforestry
Area of cropland under cover crops
Area of cropland under crop rotation
Total area under diversified farming systems
Area of cropland under fallow
Area of cropland under hedgerows
Area of cropland under home garden
Area of cropland under intercropping
Area of cropland under natural strip vegetation
Area of cropland under pull-push

factor: Amount of subsidy received as income support
description: Total amount of income support received as a subsidy (in USD).
How frequently does the farmer exchange information with agricultural extensionists?

factor: Frequency of information exchange with government
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with the government?

factor: Frequency of information exchange with NGOs
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with NGOs?

factor: Frequency of information exchange with researchers
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with researchers?
Number of different information sources the farmer uses regarding farm management.

factor: Area of land hold use rights
description: Total area of land that the household currently holds use rights to, either alone or jointly with someone else.
Total area of land that the household currently leases from another person.
Total area of land that the household currently owns.

factor: Proportion of land hold use rights
description: Proportion of the total farm area that the household currently holds use rights to, either alone or jointly with someone else.
Proportion of the total farm area that the household currently leases from another person.
Proportion of the total farm area that the household currently owns.
Number of different sales channels used for selling crops.
Number of different sales channels used for selling fish.

factor: Frequency of information exchange with consumers
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with consumers?

factor: Frequency of information exchange with food traders
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with food traders?
Number of different sales channels used for selling honey.
Number of different sales channels used for selling livestock.
Distance to the closest crop market (in minutes).
Distance to the closest farmland (in minutes).
Distance to the closest fresh water source (in minutes).
Distance to the closest livestock market (in minutes).
Distance to the closest accessible and functioning road suitable for cars (in minutes).
Percentage of the household's land that is irrigated.

factor: Frequency of information exchange with other farmers
description: How frequently does the farmer exchange information with other farmers?
Number of associations or organizations that the farmer or household members are part of.
How many years has the farmer lived in the community?
